Subjective: Fatigue for ~2 months; wakes up tired despite sleeping a lot. Sleep sometimes superficial. Onset unclear, gradual vs. sudden. Associated with increased muscle pain and back pain; morning stiffness noted. Work is manageable but exhausting; no sick days taken. Weekends spent resting. Continues climbing 2-3x/week and cycling without significant performance decline. No shortness of breath, chest pain, palpitations, specific joint pain (hands/feet), snoring, or weight change (stable 72kg). Appetite good. Bowels normal (3-4x/day). Urination normal. Hay fever controlled with medication. No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Father with history of back problems. Concern: Unsure of cause, worries about rheumatism after online search. Request: Wants blood tests to investigate.
Objective: Vitals: BP 110/60, HR 40-60 bpm. Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally. Heart: Normal sounds. Abdomen: Lively peristalsis, soft, supple, mild discomfort on deep palpation but no sharp pain. Back: Mild tenderness on palpation paravertebrally in lower back. No pain on pelvic compression. Neck/Shoulders: Full, painless range of motion.
Assessment: Fatigue, unspecified. Myalgia. Back pain. Differential diagnosis includes anemia, thyroid disorder, and inflammatory conditions. Rheumatoid arthritis considered but less likely. Cardiopulmonary etiology unlikely.
Plan: 1. Labs ordered: Blood tests for anemia, thyroid function, and inflammatory markers. 2. Patient to schedule blood draw at lab (form provided). 3. Follow-up: Patient to call clinic the day after results are received to schedule a phone appointment to discuss findings and next steps.
